title: A Divisive Building’s Unifying Revamp
sub_head: The expanded and renovated Martin Building at the Denver Art Museum has been thoughtfully retouched by architects sensitive to the style of its original designer, Gio Ponti.
body:
Denver
The Martin Building of the Denver Art Museum has been divisive, even hard to love, ever since it opened 50 years ago this month. Now a major project has unified the museum’s architecturally diverse campus and maybe even made the seven-story tower lovable.
